intro: Clidemia cordata, commonly known as heartleaf or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are usually covered in a soft, velvety texture, which contributes to its common name. Clidemia cordata is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
